image.altText: Lachie Neale, Levi Ashcroft and Cam Rayner celebrate in the sheds after the Lions won the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Brisbane secures its second straight AFL premiership, taking control in the final quarter of an otherwise gripping grand final against Geelong.

image.altText: Will Ashcroft poses with his Norm Smith Medal and AFL premiership medal.

props.synopsis: Will Ashcroft claims back-to-back Norm Smith Medals after playing a starring role in the Brisbane Lions' grand final win over Geelong.

image.altText: A close-up side profile of a man with thick brown hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's lawyers have revealed the five grounds they are seeking to appeal their client's guilty verdict on, including an allegation that the judge made an "impermissible comment to the jury".

title.children: Matt Wright's five grounds of appeal include allegation against judge

image.altText: Patches of snow on a mountain

props.synopsis: A group of tourists who were unprepared for the extreme conditions at Cradle Mountain National Park is rescued, but one member of the group dies.

title.children: Walker dies after group 'overwhelmed' by extreme weather at Cradle Mountain

image.altText: A photo of the front of the Moruya Airport.

image.altText: Chika Honda looks down as she stands in a crowded space.

props.synopsis: A Japanese tourist who served 10 years in an Australian prison for drug smuggling offences sees her story reflected in the case of Australian Donna Nelson, who was sentenced to six years in a Japanese prison for smuggling 2 kilograms of methamphetamine.

title.children: How a tourist on a dream Australia trip ended up spending 10 years in prison

image.altText: Cam Roigard celebrates

image.altText: Mike Psillakis speaks of his bother mercury who was killed by a shark at a paddle out on 270925

title.children: Twin brother of shark victim's emotional tribute as he leads paddle out

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu addresses the UN from a podium, with a QR code pinned to his blazer.

image.altText: Yuna sits down on the floor while Minu holds a mickey mouse toy.

props.synopsis: Minu and Yuna Jo's bodies lay in a storage unit for four years. They finally have justice after their mother was found guilty of their murders seven years after they were killed.

image.altText: a man with sunglasses sits in a large chair

image.altText: A man with blond hair and a blue sweat band standing in front of the sea link ferry.

image.altText: A man in a suit points and looks on.

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, with Matt Kean and Chris Bowen behind him.

image.altText: A graphic with a China flag, a rising arrow and sheep

title.children: Wool price soars as production crashes and Chinese demand lifts

image.altText: Image of mountains in the background, overlooking a coastal scene.

For roughly the price of an inner-city apartment, conservationists have bought multiple small islands off the coast of Gippsland to protect their ecosystems and wildlife.

image.altText: A young Indigenous teen girl points with a pointer in a classroom

props.synopsis: Jaz Fusi has been passionate about learning Paakantyi language for most of her life. Now, she teaches it to her local school's teachers and is eager to see other kids do the same.
